column4: anyone about xdg-open please? 'xdg-open file://' for userA open firefox, but for userB open w3m. How to change it to firefox as default?
what desktop environment?
gnome. 'xdg-open http://...' works correct for both users.
then change the association in system > preferences > preferred applications
'xdg-mime' does not help... works only for files. alternatives x-www-browser in /etc is correct
prefered applications are correct for both users. Also firefox setting "default browser" is yes for both users.
does it work if you run gnome-open directly?
yes, gnome-open works. The only link which point to w3m in /etc/alternatives is www-browser (not x-www-browser).
then figure out why the /usr/bin/xdg-open script is not running gnome-open
I need to fix xdg-open, because it is used from lazarus and it does not open in browser.
the logic is pretty simple: it checks for KDE_FULL_SESSION and GNOME_DESKTOP_SESSION_ID in the environment
make sure the former is not set and the latter is
ah, it is script... them let me check. thanks a lot

I login as userA but run lazarus (xdg-open) as userB. So, no gnome session for userB. Still wondering 'xdg-open http://' works (x-www-browser), but 'ï»¿xdg-open file://' does not work (www-browser). Both are URL, why they are different types?
why would you run a GUI app as a different user?
it is convinient (using 'xhost +si:localuser:userB)
but why it use useful?
I have few restricted users, separate home dirs.. instead of login or switch user, this is how I do it. I do not know is it wrong, but I like it.
well, xdg-open's open_generic function seems to do odd things with file:/// uris, but I guess you could artificially export GNOME_DESKTOP_SESSION_ID
another option - for userB, change PATH and put there different odg-open?
I mean, xdg-open (sorry)
that would work, I guess ...
assuming it doesn't run /usr/bin/xdg-open
right !! :) Ok, thanks a lot.
